#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Investigators blame pilot error for AirAsia crash into Java Sea
#Text=Wednesday , December 2 , 2015
#Text=Indonesia 's National Transportation Safety Committee yesterday declared pilot error to be behind the crash of Indonesia AirAsia Flight 8501 .
#Text=All 162 passengers and crew died when the plane crashed into the Java Sea a year ago .
#Text=The crashed aircraft , photographed in April 2014 .
#Text=Image : Oka Sudiatmika .
#Text=The Airbus A320-200 was around 40 minutes from Surabaya 's Juanda International Airport to Singapore 's Changi International Airport when it vanished on December 28 .
#Text=Wreckage and bodies were found floating two days later ; National Search and Rescue Agency divers led an international recovery effort but over 50 bodies remain lost .
#Text=The pilots were facing a fault with the rudder travel limiter , a part involved in rudder control .
#Text=They repeatedly received warnings on their Electronic Centralized Aircraft Monitoring ( ECAM ) system .
#Text=The first three times Indonesian Pilot Iriyanto and French co-pilot Remi Emmanuel Plesel followed correct procedure only for the fault to recur .
#Text=The fourth time , they tried something else — based on Flight Data Recorder readouts , investigators believe they reset power to their Flight Augmentation Computers .
#Text=The computers are principally responsible for rudder control and aircraft stability .
#Text=With both computers switched off , the entire fly-by-wire system of semi-automation disconnected , as did the autopilot and autothrust systems .
#Text=The pilots were now left to fly entirely manually , without automation that protects the aircraft from entering unusual and dangerous positions .
#Text=A miscommunication followed .
#Text=Iriyanto asked Plesel , who was flying , to " pull down " .
#Text=Plesel pulled the controls down , which pitched the nose up ; Iriyanto had wanted to descend .
#Text=The flight ascended without permission through 36,000ft with a ground speed of 353 knts .
#Text=The aircraft would normally be travelling faster , with a nearby Emirates jet at a ground speed of 503knts at 36,000ft .
#Text=The aircraft also banked as the disengagement of automation left the rudder off-centre .
#Text=A ship carries the aircraft 's recovered tail .
#Text=Image : Antonio P. Turretto Ramos , US Navy .
#Text=The AirAsia flight reached 38,000ft and entered a stall .
#Text=The crew did not manage to regain control .
#Text=The 155 passengers and seven crew died when the plane hit the sea .
#Text=Most were Indonesians , but for three South Koreans , one Malaysian , one Brit , and French national Plesel .
#Text=The fault was traced to cracked solder on a circuit board .
#Text=It had repeatedly occurred in the weeks before the crash .

#Text=The investigation concluded maintenance failings contributed to the disaster , but Muhammad Alwi of the Indonesian Transportation Ministry said " Repeated trouble in maintenance is a normal thing[ ... ]

#Text=Ex-BEA boss Jean-Paul Troadec said to AFP  Several recommendations of the ( BEA ) on the subject of pilot training were clearly not implemented by [ AirAsia ] . "

column1: #Text=Indonesia saw such an accident on New Years ' Day 2007 when Adam Air Flight 574 crashed into the Makasser Strait near Sulawesi .
#Text=The plane suffered a failure on a navigational instrument .
#Text=While pilots were troubleshooting for this navigational system they first unintentionally disconnected the autopilot , then lost control and crashed into the sea .
